docs.lead_paragraph: Many men gain a new sense of responsibility and purpose when they become fathers. A new study suggests they also gain 3 to 5 pounds.

headline.main: Becoming a Dad? Expect to Gain 3 to 5 Pounds, Study Suggests
headline.print_headline: Becoming a Dad? Expect to Gain 3 to 5 Pounds, Study Suggests

docs.lead_paragraph: This play by Clifford Odets, directed by Stephen Brown-Fried at the Public Theater, is about a struggling Bronx family with aspirations.

headline.main: Review: ‘Awake and Sing!,’ a Depression-Era Family Drama
headline.print_headline: A Depressed Country, a Scheming Family

docs.lead_paragraph: A civil rights activist who drew national attention for self-identifying as a black woman despite being the child of white parents, told magazine Vanity Fair she did not lie, but her critics are limited by their views of race: "I would say I'm black."

headline.main: Ex-Washington State NAACP Leader Dolezal: 'I Would Say I'm Black'
headline.print_headline: Ex-Washington State NAACP Leader Dolezal: 'I Would Say I'm Black'

docs.lead_paragraph: An 18-year-old French teen born with the AIDS virus has had her infection under control and nearly undetectable despite stopping treatment 12 years ago — an unprecedented remission, doctors are reporting.

headline.main: Doctors Say Teen's HIV in Check for 12 Years Without Drugs
headline.print_headline: Doctors Say Teen's HIV in Check for 12 Years Without Drugs

docs.snippet: An 18-year-old French teen born with the AIDS virus has had her infection under control and nearly undetectable despite stopping treatment 12 years ago — an unprecedented remission, doctors are reporting.

docs.lead_paragraph: Wisconsin Governor Scott Walker, a Republican presidential hopeful, signed a bill into law on Monday banning abortion after 20 weeks of pregnancy that makes no exceptions for pregnancies resulting from rape or incest.

headline.main: Wisconsin Governor Walker Signs 20-Week Abortion Ban Into Law
headline.print_headline: Wisconsin Governor Walker Signs 20-Week Abortion Ban Into Law

docs.snippet: Wisconsin Governor Scott Walker, a Republican presidential hopeful, signed a bill into law on Monday banning abortion after 20 weeks of pregnancy that makes no exceptions for pregnancies resulting from rape or incest.

docs.lead_paragraph: Republican Wisconsin Gov. Scott Walker, one week after launching his bid for the 2016 presidential nomination, signed a bill Monday that outlaws non-emergency abortions at or beyond 20 weeks of pregnancy.

headline.main: GOP Presidential Hopeful Walker Signs Abortion Ban Bill
headline.print_headline: GOP Presidential Hopeful Walker Signs Abortion Ban Bill

docs.snippet: Republican Wisconsin Gov. Scott Walker, one week after launching his bid for the 2016 presidential nomination, signed a bill Monday that outlaws non-emergency abortions at or beyond 20 weeks of pregnancy.

docs.lead_paragraph: The actress, who has a recurring role on “The Americans,” plays a sports agent in the Fernanda Coppel play at Second Stage Uptown.

headline.main: Karen Pittman on What It Takes to Be ‘King Liz’
headline.print_headline: At the Top of Her Game

docs.abstract: Snapshot interview with Karen Pittman who discusses her role playing driven sports agent in Fernanda Coppel play King Liz,  other acting projects, and life as single mom.
docs.snippet: The actress, who has a recurring role on “The Americans,” plays a sports agent in the Fernanda Coppel play at Second Stage Uptown.
